answers.answer: Wouldn't hurt to have it checked out, but I'd also have a chemical panel ran on her.  Sounds like thyroid disorder, diabetes, just to list a couple of possibilities.  Another possibility I can think of is seizures.  Had a friend on another panel who's son would start by getting really upset and then would go into a seizure.Would not mess around with it if I was you.  Would have my little one at the drs.  But I would be ready to fight for her b/c most drs think that 3 year olds are just that way.  Seems you have to fight for almost any dr to listen to any legit claim at any age.Good luck.  She is a really lucky little girl to have you for a mother and know you will do the very best you can for her.Dac

question: My 3 year old daughter has night terrors, night sweats, and is extremely moody.  If you tell her no, sometimes she's fine with it...or sometimes she'll start whining and throwing a fit like a normal 3 year old...but there are OTHER times when she flat out tantrums like she's out of control.  Her behavior is very similar to the behavior in her night terrors - shaking, seeming like she's somewhere else, screaming/crying, etc.  At these times, it "feels" like it's chemical and she has no control over it.  I've read online that tantrums like these and night terrors are sometimes linked to bipolar.  But, she's so young, I'm afraid I won't find a doctor who would take it seriously with her age.  Thoughts?
title: Could this be bipolar?
